alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 20 at 2:17PM PDT until March 22 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TUESDAY TO 5 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * CHANGES...Upgraded to Winter Storm Warning. Adjusted timing due to snow impacts beginning and ending earlier. * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 8 inches for communities generally north of Bridgeport, 8 to 15 inches for communities generally south of Conway Summit, and 2 to 3 feet along the crest. Winds gusts up to 70 mph along ridgelines. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...From 5 AM Tuesday to 5 AM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snowfall is expected early Tuesday morning into the early afternoon with snowfall rates between 1 to 2 inches per hour likely. Thunder is possible (15% chance) during the afternoon.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
